text: <!channel> - good morning. Do you have an everything to be successful during this weekend’s sprint? If not, please ping me so that I can help facilitate.

elements.text: - good morning. Do you have an everything to be successful during this weekend’s sprint? If not, please ping me so that I can help facilitate.

text:
Hey <@UV8B0679P>, curious where the weekend Sprint was communicated?

And, more broadly, there are a few key things that aren't clear to me:

1. A number of people here are building Bots but there is no universal agreement on what these bots should enable. Is that documented somewhere?
2. A number of bots have been built but I haven't seen a clear plan on how they're being rolled out. Is that documented anywhere?

elements.text: Hey

, curious where the weekend Sprint was communicated?

And, more broadly, there are a few key things that aren't clear to me:
A number of people here are building Bots but there is no universal agreement on what these bots should enable. Is that documented somewhere?
A number of bots have been built but I haven't seen a clear plan on how they're being rolled out. Is that documented anywhere?

text: The above two points are critical to ensuring we're building high-value tools that have the potential of getting high adoption

elements.text: The above two points are critical to ensuring we're building high-value tools that have the potential of getting high adoption

text:
Hi <@U0105ALMEKU> - sure

The Weekend Sprint was kicked off at last night’s <https://ethiopia-covid19.slack.com/archives/C010695DKMM/p1586542679295500|all hands on call>. The meeting minutes and this weekend’s work streams are listed <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JmKvWJRqNxiVK5tNM-vG2q5kIASraq0CCfPHqvEs1GY/edit|here>.

To answer your two questions;

1. We should do a better job of explaining what these bots are supposed to do and what issues they solve for; but generally, there are 3 types of bots that are built: 
• *Awareness Bots (WhatsApp, Telegram, Messenger) (Status: 99.99% Done)*
• Demo: (Telegram: <https://t.me/Covid_robot>), (WhatsApp: TBD), (Messenger: TBD)
• GitHub: <https://github.com/Ethiopia-COVID19/bot>
• *Data Collection Bots (WhatsApp, Telegram, Messenger) (Status: 99.99% Done)*
• Demo: (Telegram: <https://t.me/Covid_robot>), (WhatsApp: TBD), (Messenger: TBD)
• GitHub: <https://github.com/Ethiopia-COVID19/bot>
• *Space Vacancy Bot (Telegram) (Status: 60% Done)*
• Demo: (Telegram: TBD)
• GitHub: <https://github.com/Ethiopia-COVID19/Hotel-Vacancy-Telegram-Bot>
2. The plan right now is to have all the bots rolled out as part of the “Africa COVID-19 Response Toolkit”, which will most likely be announced mid next week. Here is the first <https://medium.com/africa-covid-19-response-toolkit/5-key-steps-in-mobilizing-covid-19-response-efforts-in-africa-778235ea2d88|blog post> about it.

text:
Truly appreciate the quick response, <@UV8B0679P>! No worries about the edits :slightly_smiling_face: We all suffer from fat fingers sometimes!

I like what you've listed; however, I'd highly recommend that we put a pause to any "launch" of sorts until we properly audit the various bots that exist, their purpose, where they overlap, and what number(s) they're attached to. We need to be able to easily articulate that to others otherwise we risk confusing users.

elements.text: Truly appreciate the quick response,
! No worries about the edits

We need to be able to easily articulate that to others otherwise we risk confusing users.

text: What are your thoughts on that? I know our motto is "Speed over perfection" but we should still be cautious on this.

text: Happy to talk through it to better understand your concerns. Would you mind gather a few folks from this team and do a quick call?

text: Certainly up for that! Anytime today works on my end.

Are you guys available for a call today to chat with <@UV8B0679P> about putting together a rollout plan for these bots? I recommend 3PM EST/10PM in Addis/12PM in the West Coast.

text: <!channel> <@UV8B0679P> We need to understand what each bot does, what each bot plans to do, which features are planned, which features are out of scope, etc... so I've put together <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1sSzKLhdDm9mBCtO1WCI2-2IJs9BsdOGaT9-v1AfuGFY/edit#gid=0|this spreadsheet> to track all the bots that have been created. If you've created a bot, please update this spreadsheet with info specific to your bot. If you can think of specific feature that is not represented/captured, please add it.

(still some parts are missing, specifically the third level options)
